ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automatic generation of academic presentation slides from research papers.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intelligent PDF Processing â€¢ Multi-Agent Framework â€¢ Interactive Customization â€¢ Pedagogical Optimization â€¢ Multimodal Output
ðŸ“– Summary: Auto-Slides is a system that automatically generates presentation slides from academic research papers. It uses a multi-agent framework and large language models to extract content, plan the presentation, and optimize for pedagogical effectiveness, offering interactive customization and multimodal output.

ðŸŒŸ web-file-explorer-icons | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enhancing the visual appearance of web-based file explorers with Catppuccin-themed icons.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Catppuccin theme support â€¢ Support for multiple platforms (GitHub, GitLab, Gitea, Forgejo, Bitbucket, Tangled)
ðŸ“– Summary: The repository provides Catppuccin-themed icons for file explorers on various web-based platforms like GitHub, GitLab, Gitea, Forgejo, Bitbucket, and Tangled. It is implemented as a browser extension available on Chrome, Firefox, and Edge, enhancing the visual appeal of these platforms with soothing pastel icons.

âœ¨ OpenTagViewer | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Tracking Apple AirTags on Android devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ View current location of AirTags on Android â€¢ Track and save historical location data â€¢ UI customization options
ðŸ“– Summary: OpenTagViewer is an Android application that allows users to track Apple AirTags on their Android devices. It leverages the FindMy.py library to retrieve location data and provides a user interface for viewing current and historical locations of AirTags, a feature not natively available on iOS.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ weevely3 | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Post-exploitation of web servers to gain remote shell access and perform various administrative and penetration testing tasks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Shell access to the target â€¢ SQL console pivoting on the target â€¢ HTTP/HTTPS proxy to browse through the target â€¢ Upload and download files â€¢ Spawn reverse and direct TCP shells
ðŸ“– Summary: Weevely is a weaponized web shell designed for post-exploitation. It allows remote shell access to a target web server by uploading a PHP agent, offering modules for administrative tasks, maintaining access, privilege escalation, and network spreading.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ gonzo | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Analyzing and visualizing log data in real-time from various sources within a terminal environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time log analysis â€¢ Kubernetes and OTLP native support â€¢ Interactive dashboard with charts â€¢ Advanced filtering (regex, attribute, severity) â€¢ Customizable themes
ðŸ“– Summary: Gonzo is a Go-based terminal UI (TUI) log analysis tool. It provides real-time analysis of log streams from various sources like stdin, files, Kubernetes, and OTLP, offering features like interactive dashboards with charts, advanced filtering, customizable themes, and AI-powered insights.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ cagent | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Orchestrating AI agents with specialized capabilities to solve complex problems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Agent creation using YAML configuration â€¢ MCP server support (stdio, http, sse) â€¢ Docker MCP Toolkit integration â€¢ Agent exposure as MCP tools â€¢ Customizable agent behavior with instructions and toolsets
ðŸ“– Summary: cagent is a multi-agent runtime that allows users to create and run intelligent AI agents with specialized knowledge, tools, and capabilities. It supports MCP servers for accessing external tools and can expose agents as MCP tools for other clients to use.
